incidents.name: Users unable to login via Google OAUTH to next.integromat.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Notice:  The root cause of this issue with next.integromat.com was caused by a configuration error, where an outdated SSL certificate was mistakenly deployed instead of the valid one.
New certificate has been deployed.  We are monitoring the status.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are aware that the SSL certificate for next.integromat.com has expired, causing accessibility issues. Users are unable to login via Google OAUTH

Our team is actively working on renewing and deploying the updated certificate. We will provide updates as soon as the issue is resolved. Thank you for your patience!

incidents.name: The "Make for Google Sheets" add-on is currently unavailable on Google Workspace Marketplace

incident_updates.body: We are working on review of new add-on for Google Sheets together with Google team.
We have shared deployment instructions for the workaround with users and are actively working on a permanent solution.
We've identified a workaround and will provide users with clear instructions on how to proceed shortly.
Our team is currently investigating the issue and working on restoring the add-on as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Quickbooks Apps disruption

incident_updates.body: The Intuit OAuth services are back operational.
Intuit OAuth services are currently experiencing an incident. Scenarios that depend on Quickbooks Apps are presenting issues at the moment.

incidents.name: us1.make.com - webhooks not responding

incident_updates.body: There was a 15-minutes disruption causing delayed webhook responses. The issue has now been resolved

incidents.name: us1.make.com - scenarios not processing the queue

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All queues have been processed and we observe no delays or other issues.
We keep monitoring the zone and the situation seems normal.

We have identified the cause of the issue and applied a fix and we see the zone recovering to a healthy state.
We will monitor the situation for the next hour before this issue is considered resolved.
The current impact is partial delays on scenarios executions. Our engineers are still working on solving the issue. We will provide an update within the next hour.
We are investigating an issue where some users might experience delays to process the records in the scenarios queue.

incidents.name: Delays on webhooks eu1.make.celonis.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The zone is operational and we will be monitoring it in the next hours.
We have identified an issue were some scenarios might take longer than usual to be processed. Our engineers are investigating the issue and we'll provide an update within 1 hour

incidents.name: Facebook Lead Ads - "New Lead" module data

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting the "Facebook Leads Ads - New Lead" module has been resolved. Leads are being fetched correctly. For customers impacted during the affected period (Monday, 27 January, 3:00 pm CET - Tuesday, 28 January, 12:30 pm CET), we will be sending out detailed email instructions on how to manually retrieve any missing leads using the "Watch Leads" module. We apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused.

We identified the root cause of the issue in our infrastructure and have taken steps to mitigate it. Leads were not reliably delivered in the period of Monday 27 January 3:00 pm CET - Tuesday 28 January 12:30 pm CET. According to our telemetry, fetching of new leads using the Facebook Leads Ads - New Lead module is now working correctly. Leads that were not delivered during the affected period will not be automatically redelivered and users will need to fetch the data from Facebook Leads Ads manually, using the Watch Leads module. Users who have contacted our Customer Support team have been informed about the workaround. We continue monitoring the situation.

We experience issues with the "Facebook Leads Ads - New Lead" module, not fetching new lead correctly. Our dev team is investigating the issue together with Meta team. However, it seems to be caused by Meta API problems, as users across various platforms are reporting the same issue in their community.
As of now, we do not have an estimated time for resolution, and we regret any inconvenience this issue may cause.

incidents.name: EU2 delayed responses

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented. We are currently monitoring the results.
This issue has been identified and we are currently working on a fix.
We are investigating an issue on EU2. At the moment, the zone reports delayed or failed responses. Scenario executions are not affected by this.

incidents.name: Slow webhook and web page response

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified an issue causing slow responses from webhooks and web pages in the eu2.make.com zone. The issue is now stable, and our engineers are actively monitoring the situation.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved

We are currently facing an issue where some of the users might experience a delay on the processing of the queues records on their scenarios. That does not affects all scenarios.

incidents.name: Scenario Queue Not Being Processed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified an issue in our code and have rolled out a fix. The changes have been applied, and we will be closely monitoring the situation.

We are currently experiencing an issue with scenario queue execution. It appears to be similar to the problem we encountered earlier today. This issue is being observed on eu1.make.com and us1.make.com.
Our team is actively investigating the problem and will provide an update within the next 2 hours or sooner if possible.
Thank you for your patience.

As of now, we do not have an estimated time for resolution, and we regret any inconvenience this issue may cause.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: Issues with webhooks processing and scenario executions on EU1-enterprise zone

incident_updates.body: We are no longer observing errors, our systems are fully operational. This issue is now resolved.

incidents.name: Delayed webhooks and scenario on US1-enterprise zone

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All systems are back to normal operation.
We expect the queue of scenario activity logs to be fully processed within 4 hours and we will keep monitoring the situation until then.

The clusters scenario execution functionality has been restored and all queued executions have been processed. The backlog of scenario execution log entries is being processed at a slower rate and activity logs for completed executions will be displayed in the scenario history with a delay.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified the likely root cause of the problem and started implementing corrective action. We will provide another update in the next 30 minutes.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating delays with webhook processing and scenario processing on US1-enterprise zone. We will update this incident in 30 min with more details.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified an issue with incoming webhooks, which are being delayed. Our team is looking into the issue now. Please stay tuned for further updates within the next hour.

incidents.name: Issues with Google Drive module

incident_updates.body: We've identified the issue and successfully delivered a hotfix stabilizing the Google Drive upload. The incident is now resolved.

We're actively investigating the issue and have identified that it originates on Google's side. We're in contact with their team to understand why we're being blocked and working together to resolve it as quickly as possible.

We're facing issues with the Google Drive module, particularly with file uploads. While some uploads may work partially with empty files, they're still causing scenarios to fail. We'll keep you updated as the day progresses.

incidents.name: Google Drive (upload a file) returns error

incident_updates.body: The issue was caused by a third-party vendor (Google API). It has been resolved as of 27th of September at 3:00 CEST. All services are now fully operational.

Our engineers are still trying to resolve the issue with files uploading via the Google Drive module, which is not working properly in US zones. The team is investigating the issue and working to resolve it as quickly as possible. We will provide updates as soon as more information is available. Thank you for your patience.

We are currently experiencing an issue with the Google Drive (upload a file) module, which is not working properly in US zones. Our team is investigating the issue and working to resolve it as quickly as possible. We will provide updates as soon as more information is available. Thank you for your patience.

incidents.name: Delays on scenario execution

We are currently investigating an issue on eu1.make.com where scenarios executions can be delayed for a few minutes.

incidents.name: Issues with "Facebook Lead Ads" module

incident_updates.body: This incident was resolved on Meta's side. Thanks for your patience while we addressed this issue with Meta team.
Meta has applied a fix which has improved the situation by reducing the number of errors. However, the issue has not yet been entirely resolved and Meta is being focused on solving the problem.

We are currently experiencing an issue with the Facebook Lead Ads module, which is not working properly.

We have identified it to be on Meta side, also being reported on their community here: https://developers.facebook.com/support/bugs/904673388147179/

We are working closely with our development team and Meta on this.

incidents.name: Connection Issues with Make.com and Public Zones

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The connection issues affecting Make.com and public zones web pages were related to our third-party vendor, Cloudflare, which experienced a high level of HTTP errors. 

A fix has now been implemented by CloudFlare, and the situation is currently stable.

We have thoroughly checked the Make platform, and there are no related issues on our end.

For more information, please refer to the Cloudflare incident details:
https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/f116htkkp7hn

We will continue to monitor the situation and keep you updated if anything changes.
Thank you for your patience and understanding

We are currently experiencing connection issues affecting Make.com and public zones web pages. Users may experience slow loading times or may be unable to access certain pages.
Our team is working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will keep you posted with further updates.
Thank you for your patience.

incidents.name: US1 Enterprise zone unstable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We have re-enabled 26 scenarios that were affected/disabled by this incident.

As per the last update, the platform on us1.make.celonis.com has been stable. However, we did identify that certain scenarios were deactivated as a side effect of this incident. We will proceed with re-enabling them from our end. Thank you for your understanding.
We have implemented a fix, and scenario executions are now fully functional. We will continue to monitor the situation for some time.
We are still actively working on the fix, unfortunately, scenario executions are currently affected.

incidents.name: Short outage in eu1.make.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Dear Users,

We would like to inform you about an outage that occurred earlier today, causing downtime for scenario executions and webhook functionality for approximately 15 minutes (between 17:10 and 17:25 CEST) in the eu1.make.com zone. The platform is now fully stable. The issue was caused by an unexpected problem with a third-party queuing tool, which encountered hardware-related difficulties. We will continue to monitor the situation closely for the next hour.

Thank you for your understanding.

incidents.name: Problems executing scenarios with Gmail app

incident_updates.body:
This incident is now resolved. 
Important note: we have re-enabled all the deactivated scenarios affected by this incident.
A fix has been implemented, and the platform is fully operational for all Make zones. We will be monitoring the situation for the next 2 hours.
The issue has been identified within the Gmail app, and we are working on the fix.

Were investigating an issue with the Gmail app that is causing scenarios that use this app to fail. This issue impacts all Make zones. Scenarios that dont use the Gmail app are not affected. We will update this Statuspage within the next hour, or as more information comes to hand.

incidents.name: Problems adding modules to scenarios

incident_updates.body: We had an incident in the zone us1.make.celonis.com where it was not possible to add new modules to scenarios and effectively create new scenarios. Our engineers have identified the problem and applied the fix.

incidents.name: Facebook Lead Ads - New Lead (trigger)

incident_updates.body:
The issue has now been resolved by the Meta team.
As part of their investigations, the Meta team has identified missed leads and will begin backfilling them. We have emailed all impacted Make users with an update and will now close this issue

The Meta team is continuing to work on this issue as a top priority. We are closely tracking progress with them. We have also emailed all impacted Make users with further advice and suggested workarounds.

Were aware of an issue affecting the Facebook Lead Ads - New Lead module. Users of this module may experience that some new leads are not being sent. We have partnered with Meta to identify the issue, and they are working on a resolution. We are in close contact with them to fix it as quickly as possible. We're sorry for any disruption this causes, and will keep you updated here.

incidents.name: DB performance issues on us1.make.com and eu1.make.com

incident_updates.body:
Dear Users,

We are providing this retrospective update regarding an issue that occurred today between 13:00 and 14:00 UTC. During this time, you may have experienced instability with our platform in the US1 and EU1 regions.

We have identified the cause of the issue within our database, and the functionality of our platform is now fully operational.

Thank you for your understanding!
